constituent: utensil, mouth, large, St. Bernard, mouth4
heisigStory: The picture in this kanji is not a pleasant one. It shows a large and fluffy St. Bernard dog stretched out on a table all stuffed and stewed and garnished with vegetables, its paws in the air and an apple in its mouth. At each corner of the table sits an eager but empty mouth, waiting for the utensils to arrive so the feast can begin.
koohiiStory1: Imagine four hungry mouths all sitting around the table. They are all banging their utensils on the table waiting for a big meal to be placed in the centre.
koohiiStory2: Note: 器 by itself means container/caliber/vessel. And 食器 means eating utensils ("food container", hehe).
myStory: đồ bếp nĩa thìa. một nơi lớn có ngăn kéo chứa dĩa thìa
words: treasured article or vessel, outstanding individual
